containment: Enforce GDVS flow: commit -> seal -> verify -> pytest; reject dirty-tree seals.
Protect canonical paths (gdvs/, seals/, scripts/verify_*) via CODEOWNERS/review.
threats.description: Legitimate contributor attempts subtle drift or policy weakening while preserving apparent functionality.
detection: Require PR-only changes for governance/policy artifacts; block direct-to-main.
Run pytest + verify_repo_seals in pre-push and CI; fail on any WARN/FAIL.
threats.name: Insider Guardian Attack
recovery: Rollback to last sealed good HEAD; re-run D1-D3; re-seal corrected head.
Invalidate compromised seals by re-keying signer and re-anchoring epoch if needed.

containment: Pin dev tools in requirements-dev.txt; prohibit implicit global pytest usage.
Use isolated venv per repo; never run governance checks from global Python.
threats.description: Modified Python/pip/git behavior or compromised environment alters outputs or verification results.
detection: Run scripts/verify_environment.py; treat WARN as blocking in D2/D3 gates.
Cold-clone proof: venv install + verify_repo_seals + pytest must pass.
threats.name: Toolchain Poisoning
recovery: Rebuild venv from scratch (delete .venv); reinstall from requirements-dev.txt; rerun proofs.
If system Python suspect, reinstall Python and re-verify cryptographic libs and PATH.

containment: Disallow force-push on protected branches; require linear history rules where possible.
Record epoch anchor + head in A9 output; fail if anchor regresses.
threats.description: Replay of old seals/epochs or rollback attempts to reintroduce previously valid artifacts.
detection: Verify latest epoch anchor tag and verify_epoch_anchor.py in CI.
Seal verification must target introduced seal hash12; reject mismatched head/target.
threats.name: Time-Shift Attacks
recovery: Recreate epoch anchor from last known-good commit; re-run verify_epoch_anchor.py.
Reissue missing seals for any commits between anchor and head; rerun A9.

containment: Prefer lockfiles when introduced; forbid unpinned new deps without review + D2 proof.
Keep canonical JSON writer for on-disk artifacts to avoid byte drift.
threats.description: Same dependency name/version resolves to different behavior across installs or time.
detection: Cold-clone dependency install must match expected behavior; rerun twice to detect drift.
Track deterministic tree hash x2; mismatch triggers ALERT investigation.
threats.name: Supply-Chain Shape-Shifting
recovery: Re-pin or replace drifting dependency; regenerate venv; rerun D2 clone proof.
If drift persists, quarantine dependency and require reproducible source verification.
